{{Main|Maryland Terrapins football under Jim Tatum (1947â1955)}} {{NCAATeamFootballSeason |Year=1953 |Team=Maryland Terrapins |Image= |Conference=Atlantic Coast Conference |Division= |ShortConference=ACC |Record= 10â1 |ConfRecord= 3â0 |CoachRank= 1 |APRank= 1 |HeadCoach=[[Jim Tatum]] |OffCoach= |DefCoach= |OScheme=[[Split-T]] |DScheme= |StadiumArena=[[Byrd Stadium]] |Champion=National Championship
Atlantic Coast Conference Co-Championship |BowlTourney=[[1954 Orange Bowl|Orange Bowl]] vs. {{cfb link|year=1953|team=Oklahoma Sooners|title=Oklahoma}} |BowlTourneyResult=L, 0â7 }} The '''1953 Maryland Terrapins football team''' represented the [[University of Maryland, College Park|University of Maryland]] in [[National Collegiate Athletic Association]] (NCAA) [[college football]] in its first season as a member of the [[Atlantic Coast Conference]] (ACC). Maryland outscored its opponents 298â38 and recorded six defensive shutouts. [[Jim Tatum]] served as the head coach for the seventh year of his [[Maryland Terrapins football under Jim Tatum (1947â1955)|nine-year tenure]]. The season culminated with the team being bestowed the title of national champions. In the postseason, Maryland lost to {{cfb link|year=1953|team=Oklahoma Sooners|title=Oklahoma}} in the [[1954 Orange Bowl]].[http://grfx.cstv.com/photos/schools/md/sports/m-footbl/auto_pdf/08guide-11.pdf Year-by-Year Results] (PDF), ''2008 Maryland Football Media Guide'', University of Maryland, 2008. Accessed 2009-06-15. [http://www.webcitation.org/query?id=1245281443511493 Archived] 2009-06-17. ==Personnel== The 1953 team consisted of the following [[letterman
